result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian D. Hill

records.addlTxt: 11:09 AM Defendant Brian D. Hill not in court.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Brian D. Hill.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Frank has no record to make regarding DE's non-appearance.  State requests a warrant. Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian D. Hill in court.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Brian D. Hill.  Court states cases and appearances.  Court notes that DE will waive prelim in 22CF153 but not in 22CF157 per the paperwork provided today by Atty Frank.  Atty Frank states the DE will waive the prelim in 22CF153 only.  Court questions DE on waiver of prelim in 22CF153/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Atty Frank acknowledges rec. information in 22CF153, waives reading and enters NG pleas.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties in 22CF153.  Court questions status in 22CF157.  Atty Frank requests PH noting 20CF258 is also tracking.  20CF36, 22CF153, 22CT18 and 20TR3116/3117 to track.  Requests all cases be placed on for status conference.  Court would prefer the CF's be set for JT noting the age of those cases.  Court sets PH in 22CF157 for 10/20/2022 at 11:00 a.m.  This is a MANDATORY appearance.  20CF36 will go on JT calendar.  22CT18 also to be put on JT calendar.  22CF153 will also be placed on the JT calendar after 20CF258.  Bonds continued in all matters.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian D. Hill
Current: 541 7th Ave., Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 04-20-2022)
Prior: 1047 Elm St, Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965

Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.
Return date on August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date on June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:18 PM Defendant Brian D. Hill in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Defendant Brian D. Hill in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Frank does not have an offer on this case.  DE will be doing an ATR in April/May.  Atty Frank requests pre-trial and return.  Matter reset.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
for Leave to File Additional Motions

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Return date on April 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:45 PM Defendant Brian D. Hill in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Hayes.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brian D. Hill appeared by video means.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation, atty. Ryan Frank will be appointed.  State requests $250.00 Cash bond, gives non appearance/warrant history.  Atty. Hayes requests signature bond or no more than $100 Cash.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $100.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
